verbose_text: The relative abundance of Proteobacteria was also generally increased by VAN, which could lead to increased levels of lipopolysaccharide (LPS) to cross the intestinal barrier and cause inflammation [XREF_BIBR], however no increase in haptoglobin levels was seen in VAN group (XREF_FIG).
evidence: lipopolysaccharide (LPS) to cross the intestinal barrier and cause inflammation
